chunks.en: I just want to ask, am I the only one on the forum who hasn't contributed to the Nezha box office?
Mainly because I'm not interested in this type of movie, and also I haven't watched a movie in years.
You are electricity, you are light, you are the only myth.
Don't blindly follow the crowd to watch movies or say you don't watch movies. That's very 'chun' (naive/foolish).
LOL, the political forces have rushed into the comment section again.
That's right, you are the unique existence, the representative of 'I am the only one sober while everyone else is drunk', the eternal path only has meaning because of you.

I think it's fine to choose to watch or not to watch, and it's fine to praise or criticize after watching. This world should be able to accommodate different voices, just express them well; but with only 20+ comments, some people want to put on an attitude of 'I am the only one sober while everyone else is drunk', I can only treat you as a clown ğŸ¤¡.
200 million people have watched it, and even if they only watched it once, there are still nearly 1.2 billion who haven't watched it, so you're definitely not the only one.
But if you're bored enough to say 'I'm the only one who hasn't watched it', then there are probably very few people besides you.
If this were in GamerSky, your title would definitely be flamed for dozens of comments.

But to be honest, I don't like it either. I remember Ultraman Nexus and Digimon that I watched when I was a kid were indeed excellent works, so I have very high requirements for these all-ages or children-oriented works now, and it's hard to like them.
Prejudice in people's hearts is a mountain.
@xiaozecn I've seen it and even think some of the scenes are subtly mocking the government, while you haven't seen it and think it's promoted by the government.

This is the only movie I've bought a ticket to see in the past five years. I think it's pretty good. It's like Black Myth: Wukong, where the level in a certain field was very poor, and suddenly a product above the standard appeared, it will definitely sell well.

It's still very different from Wolf Warrior and The Battle at Lake Changjin. They are completely different types of movies, and there is no need to be grateful to the country, the government, or the Party.
Saying you haven't seen it is politically correct, right? I've watched it three times, do I have to kneel down and beg for forgiveness?
Haven't been to the cinema for years.
You called everyone out here just for this? .jpg
I watched it, it's good, I don't know what so many people are being sarcastic about.

You can take a look. Actually, when I saw it, I didn't know the box office was already so high. How should I put it, no one said that not watching it means you aren't Chinese, it's just a good thing to recommend to everyone.
I wonder if anyone still remembers Li Xianji's Adventure and Jiaozi's A Great Radish from 2009.
Because of this director, I went to the cinema to watch Nezha 1. To be honest, it was mediocre, just consider it supporting domestic production.
Also, my only impression of Nezha 1 now is that the voice acting of the main character Nezha is really too bad to appreciate.
This year, various domestic hype about Nezha 2 polluted my timeline, and I saw a bizarre piece of news saying that Nezha 2 was banned abroad.
It made me wonder, so I did a little fact check, and sure enough, it was a rumor, suspected to be to hype the film's content that satirizes the US.
Haha, it's not that you can't satirize America, but it's really hard to watch North Korea satirizing South Korea.

chunks.en: @hami1991 LOL, have Chinese people lost their memory of December 1, 2019 - the end of November 2022?
No, I'm not in China, and I'm not interested in everyone standing up and applauding after the movie.
I watch other movies, but mainly through online streaming services / piracy.
I haven't watched it either, I haven't been to the cinema this year.
I watched it, it felt very ordinary, the high box office scares me ğŸ˜±.
I don't plan to watch it, the art style is too ugly.
Then, it's my child's winter vacation, and we have to watch a movie, so I originally planned to buy tickets, but I found it was full and the price was expensive.
The usual movie price is 40, and there are not many people in the theater, so the experience is okay, even if the movie is not great.
This time the price is even more expensive, and it's full, so forget it, I won't watch it.
